content: हस्तिन(ना)पुरं <ab>N.</ab> of a city founded by king Hastin, said to be situated some fifty miles north-east of the modern Delhi; it forms a central scene of action in the Mahābhārata; its other names are: --गजाह्वय, नागसाह्वय, नागाह्व, हास्तिन.

हस्तिनापुर <ab>N.</ab> of a celebrated town said to have been founded by king Hastin, one of the descendants of Bharata; said to be situated about 56 miles north-east of the modern Delhi on the banks of an old channel of the Ganges.
